intro: Microstylis keysseri, commonly known as the slender spike-rush, is a flowering plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, clustered inflorescences. The plant typically grows in wetland environments, such as marshes and along the edges of ponds. Its flowers are usually inconspicuous, with three stamens and a single pistil. Microstylis keysseri is often found in temperate regions and is adapted to moist, nutrient-poor soils.
